subskills.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrate how pushing and pulling objects requires energy by moving toys across different surfaces
Sort activities into those that use more energy versus less energy using picture cards
Create simple sound patterns by using different amounts of energy to strike instruments
Match energy sources (sun, wind, electricity) to the devices they power using a sorting game
Compare the warmth of objects placed in sunlight versus shade through touch experiments
Demonstrate how stored energy works by using rubber bands to power simple toys
Identify which household activities require electrical energy versus human energy
Create shadows of different sizes by moving objects closer to and farther from a light source
Compare how objects move differently on ramps of various heights using toy cars
Demonstrate how friction affects movement energy by sliding objects on different surfaces
Sequence daily activities from those requiring least to most energy consumption
Design and test simple wind-powered devices using paper materials
